body:
@lazaridiscom I'm pretty sure there are tags available? Can you do:

`git checkout v0.1.5`:
```
Note: checking out 'v0.1.5'.

You are in 'detached HEAD' state. You can look around, make experimental
changes and commit them, and you can discard any commits you make in this
state without impacting any branches by performing another checkout.

If you want to create a new branch to retain commits you create, you may
do so (now or later) by using -b with the checkout command again. Example:

  git checkout -b <new-branch-name>

HEAD is now at 8dca7864f No dll's here
```

`git log`:
```

Author: sirius-m <sirius-m@1a98c847-1fd6-4fd8-948a-caf3550aa51b>
Date:   Wed Sep 16 13:26:04 2009 +0000

    No dll's here
    
    git-svn-id: https://bitcoin.svn.sourceforge.net/svnroot/bitcoin/trunk@8 1a98c847-1fd6-4fd8-948a-caf3550aa51b

commit 465e1d99f25cc7f45efcacfcbb1f95c1c1f9a4ee
Author: sirius-m <sirius-m@1a98c847-1fd6-4fd8-948a-caf3550aa51b>

```
